# Task

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

Here is how you can define this function:

```julia
function clean_column(col::AbstractString)
    # lowercase the column name
    col = lowercase(col)
    
    # replace any spaces or hyphens with underscores
    col = replace(col, " " => "_")
    col = replace(col, "-" => "_")
    
    # strip leading and trailing whitespaces
    col = lstrip(rstrip(col), '_')
    
    return col
end
```

The special instructions you mentioned would depend on your specific problem at hand. For example, if the column names need to be a certain length or should not contain certain characters, those details can be included in this function as well.
